programme.title: A unanimous United Nations
programme.short_synopsis: Why is a unanimous vote in the United Nations Security Council such a rare occurrence?
programme.medium_synopsis: The Soviet foreign minister denounces the action of Saddam Hussein to the United Nations, and the first, and last, unanimous vote reached by the Council in June, 1950.

display_title.title: Letter from America by Alistair Cooke
display_title.subtitle: A unanimous United Nations

programme.title: Letter from America by Alistair Cooke
programme.short_synopsis: Alistair Cooke’s weekly talks on American life, history and politics from 1946 – 2004.
